news_items.title: Costco ecommerce sales rise 18.9% in fiscal Q4
news_items.summary: Costco’s ecommerce sales grew 18.9% year‑over‑year in fiscal Q4 2024, outpacing total comparable sales. Appliances and furniture led ecommerce growth, and the Costco Next marketplace grew nearly 40%. The company also rolled out buy‑online, pick‑up‑in‑warehouse for TVs and improved mobile app search.
news_items.relevance_reason: Strong ecommerce growth, especially in furniture and appliances, signals high demand for scalable product visuals.
key_insights: Buy‑online, pick‑up program for TVs—requires rich imagery

news_items.title: Costco Wholesale Corporation Reports Fourth Quarter and Fiscal Year 2024 Operating Results
news_items.summary: In Q4 fiscal 2024, Costco’s ecommerce grew 18.9% (adjusted 19.5%) and full‑year ecommerce grew 16.1% (adjusted 16.2%). Total net sales rose 5.0% to $249.6B. Comparable sales across regions also increased.
news_items.relevance_reason: Confirms sustained ecommerce momentum, reinforcing need for scalable visual content across growing digital channels.
key_insights: Global comparable sales rising—visual consistency needed

news_items.title: Costco's E‑Commerce Sales Surge: A Dark Horse Growth Engine?
news_items.summary: In Q3 fiscal 2025, Costco’s ecommerce comparable sales surged 15.7%, outpacing overall growth of 8%. Site traffic rose 20%, AOV up 3%. New initiatives include BNPL via Affirm and a 31% rise in logistics deliveries, especially for bulky items.
news_items.relevance_reason: Ecommerce acceleration, BNPL for big-ticket items, and bulky‑item logistics highlight need for high-quality visuals pre‑launch.
key_insights: Traffic and AOV rising—better visuals boost engagement

news_items.title: Wagyu beef, $1,200 swing sets, and fake trees are helping drive up Costco sales
news_items.summary: In Q3 fiscal 2024, Costco sales rose 9.1% to $57.39B, driven by trending large and novelty items like artificial trees, wagyu beef, swing sets, and gold bullion. Gold bars generate ~$200M monthly online. App downloads grew 32%.
news_items.relevance_reason: High‑value, large‑format products and novelty items require compelling visuals to attract online buyers.
key_insights: Large novelty items—swing sets, trees—need lifestyle imagery
Gold bullion strong online seller—premium visuals matter
App engagement rising—visual content supports mobile UX

news_items.title: Costco Raises Membership Fee for First Time in 7 Years. What It Means for the Stock.
news_items.summary: Effective September 1, 2024, Costco raised membership fees from $60 to $65 (individual) and $120 to $130 (executive), impacting ~52M members. Analysts expect ~$350M incremental operating profit over two years, likely reinvested into prices and benefits.
news_items.relevance_reason: Membership fee increase may fund digital enhancements, including improved visual content and marketing.
key_insights: New revenue could fund digital/catalog investments

news_items.title: Costco braced for 'Netflix moment' after major membership card shake‑up that 'makes it quicker for shoppers to checkout'
news_items.summary: Costco introduced digital scanners at store entrances to verify membership cards, replacing manual checks. This improved shopping experience, boosted signups (analysts estimate +4M members), and provided real‑time traffic data for staffing.
news_items.relevance_reason: Digital membership infrastructure improvements suggest broader digital transformation that could include visual content modernization.
key_insights: Membership growth—more digital shoppers needing visuals
Real‑time data—potential for personalized visual content

news_items.title: Costco Reports January 2025 Net Sales of $19.51 Billion, Marking 9.2% Year‑Over‑Year Growth
news_items.summary: In January 2025, Costco net sales reached $19.51B (+9.2% YoY), with e‑commerce sales increasing 13.6% for the four‑week period. U.S. comparable sales were up 9.2%, and total net sales for first 22 weeks rose 8.2%.
news_items.relevance_reason: Continued e‑commerce growth underscores ongoing need for scalable product visuals.

news_items.title: Costco Reports April 2025 Sales of $21.18 Billion, Marking 7% Year‑Over‑Year Increase
news_items.summary: April 2025 net sales were $21.18B (+7% YoY), with e‑commerce sales up 12.6% for the month and 16.3% year‑to‑date. Costco operates 905 warehouses globally and emphasizes risk factors in forward‑looking statements.
news_items.relevance_reason: Reinforces strong e‑commerce trajectory and global scale—visual content needs across regions.

news_items.title: Costco's holiday‑season sales jump was not just about food, analyst says
news_items.summary: For the five weeks ending Jan 5, 2025, Costco sales rose 9.9% YoY to $27.52B, with e‑commerce up 34.4%, boosted by later Thanksgiving and holiday timing. Same‑store sales rose 7.4%. Analysts say e‑commerce investments are paying off.
news_items.relevance_reason: Massive holiday e‑commerce spike highlights need for pre‑launch visuals and seasonal content scalability.
key_insights: Timing shifts drive online traffic—need fast content

news_items.title: Costco's  Revenue Per Store: What the Numbers Show
news_items.summary: In fiscal 2024, average net sales per warehouse rose to $260M (+3%). Total net sales were $250B (+5%). Online sales contributed 7% of revenue. Membership fees reached $4.8B from 76.2M members. Costco added 29 new warehouses.
news_items.relevance_reason: Warehouse expansion and modest online share suggest opportunity to boost digital presence via visuals.
key_insights: Online still 7%—room to grow with visuals

news_items.title: Costco's E‑Commerce Sales Surge: A Dark Horse Growth Engine? (Zacks)
news_items.summary: Echoing Yahoo Finance, Q3 fiscal 2025 ecommerce comparable sales surged 15.7%, site traffic +20%, AOV +3%. BNPL via Affirm and 31% logistics delivery growth for bulky items are key drivers.
news_items.relevance_reason: Reinforces digital growth trends and logistics expansion—visuals support conversion on bulky categories.
key_insights: Bulky‑item logistics up 31%—visuals critical for big items
Traffic and AOV rising—better visuals improve metrics

news_items.title: Costco Reports Second Quarter and Year‑to‑Date Operating Results for Fiscal 2024 and February Sales Results
news_items.summary: In Q2 fiscal 2024, net sales rose 5.7% to $57.33B; ecommerce grew 18.4% (adjusted 18.2%). For 24 weeks, ecommerce grew 12.2% (adjusted 12.0%). Comparable sales rose across regions.
news_items.relevance_reason: Early strong ecommerce growth trend reinforces sustained need for scalable visual content.
key_insights: Regional comparable sales rising—visual standardization needed

key_opportunities: Rapid ecommerce growth in furniture and appliances
Holiday and seasonal spikes needing fast visuals
Bulky‑item and novelty product expansion online
overall_assessment.recommended_approach: Emphasize Presti’s ability to generate high‑quality lifestyle visuals for large, bulky, and seasonal items—especially furniture, appliances, and novelty products—at scale and ahead of physical availability, aligning with Costco’s booming ecommerce and catalog expansion.
